content.content: I can confirm I am not and have never been a core unit contributer.
Thanks for clarifying. I probably misunderstood some Discord convo.
CodeKnight:  I can confirm I am not and have never been a core unit contributer.   Have you ever participated in MakerDAO under another name?
I have not(although I did originally name my forum account Makerman, which I changed for obvious reasons when I started contributing).

Greenlight Supporting bIBTA- Tokenizing real world assets has huge potential. Beyond growing our RWAs, it is a service we can provide to the rest of the blockchain. I hope the DAO can put it’s expertise here to good work. Executive Supporting the current exec to onboard RWA vaults. Happy to see progress on onboarding and putting our USDC to work.

Greenlight Supporting tactical Re-allocation-Some version of this is needed for decentralization. Determining the effectiveness of CUs right now is very time-consuming and complicated. This creates a large disparity between people who spend a lot of time on the protocol vs those who don’t(and Maker holders often don’t). While this will be a large undertaking, it is necessary to have quality easy to access data on the different parts of MakerDao. Opposing Pando greenlight- While I would like to onboard green assets, the long duration and low-liquidity is a deal break for me. I firmly believe that the quality of deals we are getting will rapidly improve, both from arrangers getting more comfortable with us and us learning how to make better deals. Therefore, it is essential that we remain flexible and don’t get tied down supporting legacy deals. Support Maker Teleport- L2s are the future and essential to onboarding retail. Support Open Market Committee Proposal-The reasoning behind these changes is sound. Should increase dai minting and earn fees on LPs.

content.content: Poll Update  Ratification Poll for Core Unit Offboarding Process Amendments (MIP4c2-SP15)  (thread) Support- Reasonable improvements to the process and a better template for offboarding.  Ratification Poll for Modify Dai Foundation Core Unit Budget (MIP40c3-SP74) (thread) Bear>Base>Super Bear- I do not consider deferring a buildup of reserves as a true budget cut, so the 73% reduction does not factor in for me. A 6.5% reduction compared to the base seems like a reasonable cut. The impacts listed seem fairly modest.  Maker Teleport Deployment on Starknet and Associated Risk Parameters (thread) Support-Reasonable limits and L2 deployment is vital to the growth of Dai.  Ratification Poll for Modify Oracle Core Unit Budget (MIP40c3-SP75) (thread)  1st choice: Approve proposed budget (Reduced budget exempt from further cuts for 12 months) 2nd choice: Approve existing budget (Business as usual)  I am a bit concerned about exemption clauses becoming a default inclusion in budget requests, but as a way to manage budget cuts it seems reasonable. I am supportive of Oracle’s proactive approach to managing costs.  Ratification Poll for MIP50 Direct Deposit Module Amendment (MIP4c2-SP23) (thread) Support- Expanding the scope of MIP50 as requested is reasonable.  Ratification Poll for Offboarding Events Core Unit (EVENTS-001) (thread) Oppose- I initially supported offboarding, but the EVENTS CU has done a good job cutting costs in response to market conditions. Given the newness of the CU, it makes sense to at least let them finish out their budget cycle.  Community Greenlight Poll - Cabot (Cabot Renewable Energy Crypto Mining LLC) (thread) Oppose- The deal is highly illiquid, risky in the event of a Bitcoin crash and jurisdictionally complex. In addition to the value of the collateral plummeting in the event of a crash, the expense of taking possession of and liquidating a large collection of ASICs located in Paraguay would result in a large loss. The greenness of Bitcoin mining with hydropower is also dubious.

content.content: How does it make sense to finance DSR through increases in stability fees, particularly in a rising rate environment? Raising stability fees would make over-collateralized loans for risk-on assets (e.g. ETH, BTC, etc) less attractive, as asset valuations are expected to remain flat or decrease during this cycle, resulting in increased costs for DAI loans and higher potential for liquidations. If the DSR cannot be funded by the spread of DAI’s collateral assets (i.e. USDC, GUSD, etc) then the impact should not spread to other products and services.

Ratification Poll for the Constitution MIP Set - March 13, 2023 (thread) Voted: No This Constitution has a number of issues that make it a poor choice for the DAO. To touch on some of the major issues:   It significantly dilutes MKR holders, such as immediately printing 20K MKR.   It introduces considerable complexity and significantly raises the barrier for participation by MKR holders and ecosystem actors. Participants are going to have to navigate a large number of committees, who often have overlapping responsibilities. CVCs are a large investment of time with harsh penalties for missteps. It will benefit the politically entrenched and hurt less involve MKR holders.   It attempts to micromanage participants in damaging ways, such as encouraging MakerDAO members to dox others and will lead to witch hunts that damage uninvolved parties.   It enshrines risky behavior to the protocol, such as allowing MKR to be borrowed against as collateral.

Most of the proposed scopes are incomplete and are still works in progress; therefore, there is no guarantee that the project will be completed on time or that the desired outcomes will be achieved. Additionally, there may be unforeseen problems or issues that arise during the development process, which could cause delays. To mitigate this, a more gradual approach should be considered.

content.content: Llama  Key Info Delegate Address: 0xd2362DbB5Aa708Bc454Ce5C3F11050C016764fA6 Forum: @Llama Discord: puncar#6764 Email: [email protected] Core Values At Llama we believe in being open, building trust through collaboration and realizing possibilities together as a team. Our values are at the center of everything we do. They shape how we act with each other, our partners and help us to achieve our vision of helping communities realize their full potential. Our foundational beliefs, reflect our values:   Rigor. Work done by Llama is of the highest quality. We care deeply about getting the details right in anything we do: smart contracts, governance forum posts, or analytics dashboards.  Ownership. We treat the problems of the DAOs we work with as if they were our own. There is little to no separation between Llama and the DAOs we work with.  Trust. We seek to actively earn the trust of the DAOs we work with. We involve the community in our work and incorporate feedback where relevant.  Transparency. We believe in open lines of communication and are comfortable working in a DAO-native manner.   Delegate Statement Llama is a leading governance contributor for DAOs. We have implemented protocol upgrades, designed treasury strategies and liquidity incentive programs, and built analytics dashboards and financial reports. We work with Aave, Uniswap, dYdX, Gitcoin, Radicle, PoolTogether, FWB, Harvest Finance, Tribe DAO, Nouns, and more. Our contributors are among the most active in the crypto ecosystem and include engineers, DeFi strategists, data analysts, quants, and accountants. Our grander vision is to be a collaboration hub, with members from many of the leading DAOs across the industry all coming together to support the ecosystem’s growth. With members who have executed more than 100 meta-governance proposals, we have a deep appreciation for community engagement and understand the nuances of DAO governance. We are committed to being an active, reliable and impactful delegates for the community. We will provide a high context with a unique perspective to Maker DAO in helping the community achieve its goals and document all our voting decisions. Our votes will aim to support the growth and protection of the DeFi ecosystem and we will:  Support adoption of DAI across the DeFi ecosystem Support encourages collaboration between the Maker DAO and other DeFi communities Stand with the community against any proposals that can harm the DeFi ecosystem or MKR itself. Post our own proposals that are aligned with the two items above.  We (Llama) have read and agreed to the Delegate Code of Conduct.  Conflicts of Interest Llama has holdings and/or voting influence in other DeFi protocols, is an active participant in those protocols, and intends to be actively engaged with other DeFi communities. Llama is pro-ecosystem and does not support anticompetitive values. Some of our members are contributors in other DAOs and DeFi protocols, including Maker DAO. Our members also hold tokens of other DeFi protocols, including MKR.  Waiver of liability By delegating to Llama, you acknowledge and agree that Llama and its members will participate on a best efforts basis and will not be liable for any form of damages related to participation in the Maker Protocol, or MakerDAO.

content.content: Pooling Proposal  Asset Allocation for MIP65 (Clydesdale) - June 27, 2022 Preferable choice: US Short Treasuries (80%)+ IG Corp Bond(20%) Comment: Due to market conditions, we believe US treasuries are a very safe option with a decent yield, however, the market is still very strong, and the CDMI indicates a healthy market and that’s why we prefer the 80/20 option over 100% in treasuries https://vote.makerdao.com/polling/QmXedMr8#vote-breakdown Pooling proposal  Prioritization Sentiment - Technical Resource Deployment - June 6, 2022 At the moment we are not able to rank all the choices, but generally, we are in support of expanding D3M to bring more revenue and utility to the DAI. https://vote.makerdao.com/polling/QmYqBhDx#poll-detail Pooling proposal  Prioritization Sentiment - Collateral Class - June 6, 2022 To ensure viability and security of DAI long term we believe that utility and diversification is a key. From that perspective, we believe crypto assets are not a great option in the short term when both markets are very much connected, but can be a very viable option in the long-term when the market will be substantial enough that some of the assets (ETH or BTC) will become much less volatile. RWA is a very stable option that is aligned with the overall Maker vision and brings both diversification and utility to DAI. However, this is one of the most complex options from a legal perspective, and we need to be mindful of that and reflect it on the timeline. D3M is a great opportunity for growth and to bring more utility and resiliency to DAI long term. It has proved to be working well on AAVE and we should continue expanding on this success. In the short-term we recommend using Traditional Financial Instruments and Peg Stability Solutions, due to their stability and ease of use. https://vote.makerdao.com/polling/QmdZezCr#vote-breakdown Executive Proposal  MKR Vesting Transfers - June 22, 2022 In support of this proposal with no additional comments https://vote.makerdao.com/executive/template-executive-vote-mkr-vesting-transfers-june-22-2022#proposal-detail

content.content: Ratification Poll for Modify Dai Foundation Core Unit Budget (MIP40c3-SP74) - August 8, 2022 (thread) Voted: 1st choice: Base 2nd choice: Bear Scenario Reasoning: It is important that every core unit adjusts to the overall DAO situation; at the moment our revenue has been decreasing and we need to make sure we are allocating our funds strategically. And that can mean that we might shuffle the budgets around, not just cut everywhere. Also, we need to make sure that we are keeping our operation safe and that we have some level of protection. And that’s what the DAI foundation is providing, therefore we are strongly against the Super Bear scenario but pretty comfortable with base and bear. We chose base to support the CU plan to bring 2 other board members to strengthen the foundation, and also we don’t like that bear scenario cuts on the education budget. Ratification Poll for Core Unit Offboarding Process Amendments (MIP4c2-SP15) - August 8, 2022 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: We always support simplification and process improvements, at this point CU offboarding and budget cuts are discussed a lot and there are different answers to that. Endgame plan, Hasu’s committee approach, Project-based planning, etc. We cannot execute all of them as there is a big overlap, but we can take the best of each to create the best path forward. Till then improvements of current processes as this proposal suggesting is the right path forward. Ratification Poll for Modify Oracle Core Unit Budget (MIP40c3-SP75) - August 8, 2022 (thread) Voted: 1st choice: Approve existing budget (Business as usual) Reasoning: Risk management and overall security should always be our top priority as we are a critical piece of DeFi infrastructure and many depend on us. We appreciate the proactivity of the Oracle CU in cutting the budget on their own before someone cut it for them. Still, I would say that it’s not the perfect solution to do it only if the DAO promise not to consider their budget in the future. It’s hard to create certainty when the market is so uncertain. Therefore we vote for the current budget and would like to see how they can bring value to the DAO. For example, if the budget stays as-is - could you move forward with your Oracle as a service product and bring revenue, therefore cutting the budget needed from the DAO even more than 10%? Ratification Poll for MIP50 Direct Deposit Module Amendment (MIP4c2-SP23) - August 8, 2022 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: Making the D3M more generic and enable not just lending protocols / AAVE to interact with it is the right step forward to support the overall adoption of DAI. Ratification Poll for Makershire Redux (MIP76) - August 8, 2022 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: Based on the discussion on the forum, we are convinced that this initiative supports the adoption of the DAO while also generating some yield for the DAO. There were some risks pointed out, but based on the analyses from @monet-supply  we believe those risks are manageable, and the potential value created is higher. Ratification Poll for Offboarding Events Core Unit (EVENTS-001) - August 8, 2022 (thread) Voted: No Reasoning: To support the adoption of DAI, we need to have some marketing word of mouth is super powerful but it doesn’t happen without little support. Events are the places where people gain a conviction, and they spread it to their communities. We agree that we should be mindful of where and how much we are spending, and that’s where this core unit proved its value; they have been able to adjust the budget, find other sponsors and execute great events in the past. Organizing events is not an easy task, and so far all the events went great. Overall we need to work in the budget/market conditions we are in, but we should also think long-term, and get DAI more adoption!

We should support this application in order to give it priority vs other lower quality applications, but WAIT for mandate and team for implementation. MOMC Parameter Changes, SocGen Vault Drawdown Authorization, Recognized Delegate Compensation, HVBank Legal Agreement Amendment - August 12, 2022 The return of the funds because of compliance reasons is unfortunate but other than that, supportive of this executive vote

content.content: Voting update from @luca_pro and @Puncar Updating HVBank (RWA-009) Legal Agreements - September 5, 2022 (thread) Voted: Yes We think that the amendments are needed and do not provide an excessive extension in scope for the credit collateral. In addition, we believe that the amendments go in the direction of the business decisions the groups have had. We are supportive of this proposal. MKR Pro-Rata Vesting for former RWF-001 Members - September 5, 2022 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: We strongly believe that contributors should be compensated for the hard work - and we think that RWF-001 members did provide solid work and tangible results. Although they have not reached their cliff, they have done so due to the unilateral offboarding of RWF-001 facilitator. In TradWorld, typically, staff made redundant can benefit from its earned but yet not vested deferred comp, unless the redundancy has happened due to gross negligence. If gross negligence happened, as RWF-001’s Facilitator seems to indicate through unilateral and disordered posting of private communications, we think an audition of the two parties should be offered and we, as delegates, would like to participate Short Ratification Poll for MIP65 Amendments (MIP4c3-SP4) - September 5, 2022 (thread) Voted: No Reasoning: Connected to MIP55c3-SP8, we worry that an emergency amendment needs to be done given that RWF-001 is refusing to respect its mandate while still funded by the DAO. However, although an amendment is needed, we find this amendment way too broad and a potential attack vector, given the amounts under discussion. We would like to see other mitigating factors included in the rewording, e.g. i) narrowing the scope of the Facilitators ability to countersign (e.g. from Risk, Oracle, SES, or CES), ii) requiring an official opinion provided by external counseling, iii) clarifying requirements of the 'community member with legal credentials. We believe that voting YES to this proposal could be an extremely dangerous development of MIP65. Short Ratification Poll for Legal Work on MIP65 Special Purpose Fund (MIP55c3-SP8) - September 5, 2022 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: We vote in support of reimbursement for the work done, understanding the spirit of SF-001 to ‘get things done’ in a period of vacuum. However, and we want to reinstate this clearly, it is disappointing and worrying that RWF-001 hasn’t instead proceeded in providing financial support to one of its CU contractors to proceed with the job - given that it resides firmly in RWF-001 mandate. I believe it is time for the DAO to question not only the existence of RWF-001, but the merit on which the money was already spent - or not spent.

Update from @luca_pro and @Puncar Ratification Poll for Endgame Prelaunch MIP Set - October 10, 2022 (thread) Voted: No Reasoning: Although we believe that the protocol is in need to exit the current status of things, we are convinced that this MIP Set includes an extremely wide set of proposals not related to each other and with extremely profound impacts on the whole protocol. We are strongly against voting unrelated and deeply impacting proposals in such manner and are therefore voting NO. We are not in disagreement with some of those proposals, but we are in disagreement with others, and we would like to see the impact of each proposal being narrowed in scope and tackled one by one. Ratification Poll for Offboarding the Strategic Happiness Core Unit - SH-001 (MIP39c3-SP3) - October 10, 2022 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: We support this proposal as it is based on mutual agreement. And @aburban90 is comfortable with this decision. Ratification Poll for Offboarding the Events Core Unit - EVENTS-001 (MIP39c3-SP4) - October 10, 2022 (thread) Voted: No Reasoning: Marketing, including events, is important to increase the adoption of the DAI. But as we are in the bear market, we should be mindful of the expenses, and we believe that the events team has been able to do that at previous events, where they have found co-sponsors. Ratification Poll for Offboarding the Real-World Finance Core Unit - RWF-001 (MIP39c3-SP5) - October 10, 2022 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: RWF CU needs to be replaced by another team that can onboard RWA collateral, it might be worth having this team on a project basis rather than as a core unit. Ratification Poll for Coinbase USDC Institutional Rewards (MIP81) - October 10, 2022 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: Based on our research we believe Coinbase has one of the safest custody solutions. Therefore we believe that the USDC will be safe. On the other hand, 1.6B of USDC to be taken to less liquid custody is not ideal. We support this proposal, but we (MakerDAO) should monitor the liquidity need based on market conditions and reduce the exposure if needed or even start with the lower amount to test the solution for a couple of months. Ratification Poll for Monetalis-Coinbase Appaloosa (MIP82) - October 10, 2022 (thread) Voted: No Reasoning: We would start deploying PSM with one proposal at a time, rather than all at once. Among those proposals, the Coinbase MIP appears superior to us. In addition, we have concerned with Monetalis as a counterparty, given their deep connections with the largest MKR holder (and de facto relative majority in all those proposals) Ratification Poll for Legal And Commercial Risk Domain Work on Greenlit Collateral BlockTower Credit - RWA Arranger SPF (MIP55c3-SP9) - October 10, 2022 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: We support project-based funding with clear outcomes and benefits to MakerDAO. The legal review needs to be done, and we think it’s scoped correctly. Ratification Poll for Facilitator Offboarding Process (MIP41c5) adjustments (MIP4c2-SP26) - October 10, 2022 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: Less friction is needed if we want to operate efficiently as an organization. Ratification Poll for Facilitator Offboarding - RWF-001 (MIP41c5-SP12) - October 10, 2022 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: As we stated several times before, this had to happen, and we need to find an alternative for the RWF team to onboard new collateral.

content.content: Thanks Juan, you might be right. I’ll share my sense of things.  Calendars have a high likelihood of being picked up by GovAlpha(GOV). Call Support will fall on the shoulders of GOV (and maybe SES?) and may be degraded for the beginning of 2023. No more call summaries for public calls & one less competent host. Forum will have two fewer moderators to fix and tidy things up, though I think it could handle it. Govalpha have been the primary mods, while we mostly fix tags and categorizations. Reddit will likely lose a moderator (50% chance they move to being compensated by GOV) Emergency Comms support won’t suffer much–a lot of the documentation is 85% done and probably makes more sense to be handled within GOV anyway. Stakeholder alignment will likely end in its current state, though I think a good template for how it could be done was set. Others can run similar calls if they feel it’s needed. Collateral Management is changing so I don’t think the CM call is going to carry on in its current form (TBD) and same goes for Security as IS-001 has a high likelihood of being offboarded and generally speaking it’s just been GOV/COM/TECH/IS at those meetings. The SEC milestones we set are valuable and I hope GOV won’t let them get dropped. Stakeholder Content; Weekly Relay, Forum at a Glance, and the Aggregated CU Updates thread likely won’t get picked up right away, if at all. I don’t know what the future of stakeholder content would look like. Stakeholder Database will stop being updated, though we intended to give it over to SES to integrate it into the Ecosystem Dashboard they are developing. Afterall we did the legwork for the GDPR compliance and have a good foundation of data. Stakeholder Notices; I imagine have a high likelihood of being picked up by GOV. Trackers; Some may be picked up, others will become obsolete. I imagine if anyone picks them up it would be GOV. Additionally, for current events tracking, we started doing short research papers to sum things up as a point of reference. That work would likely stop.

content.content: Llama:  Reasoning: We believe this proposal is not consistent with the risk characteristics of the PSM   Hi Llama, which risks specifically?

Thank you @Pete, In its current form, the PSM reminds us closely a proprietary treasury book of banks, that are free to invest it in low-risk yet yielding securities. Although originated through a different mechanism (providing a stabilisation mechanism to arb-out the positive spread between $DAI and the US dollar, rather than customer deposits) the PSM represents de facto the portion of liquidity that the protocol believes idle and in excess in the system, and that it partially intends to deploy to get proprietary yield without jeopardising balance sheet liquidity. We can argue at length about the i) opportunity to circle back on-chain liquidity through off-chain structure for Maker, or ii) ability and incentive-compatibility of Maker to negotiate and initiate credit lines in the 100s of MM, etc. – but what is extremely clear to us is that any yield-generating strategy within the PSM should be as close as possible (if not absolutely equal) to the underlying credit and liquidity risk of the asset arb’ed. This means that any investment that differs materially from Circle’s own treasury strategy (for what concerns the $USDC endowment) should be absolutely ruled out. It is our understanding that $OUSD intends to provide yield by exposing Maker to specific protocol risk and benefits of the DeFi protocols it interacts with – beyond those specific to Origin. We have no intention to discuss the materiality of those risks, nor the execution quality, we want to flag that those risks are very different from those underpinning the stables part of the PSM, and therefore should not be considered as a suitable deployment venue. cc’ing @Llama

Advise and support Maker with Treasury Management initiatives Establish dynamic exchanges between innovate teams like Maker and its partners to further encourage Web-3 growth.  Delegate Statement [email protected] is Columbia University’s premier non-profit blockchain organization focusing on educating and empowering crypto builders, researchers, and creators. We launched the first student group DAO, Lion DAO, in 2021. Some DAO activities include a grants program which encourages Web-3 research. Our annual conference, Ledgerfest, focused on crypto and web3 founders from Arbitrum, Polygon, Cosmos, Drift, Audius, and more! We host weekly speakers like Aave’s Founder Stani, Nansen’s Founder Alex, and we host weekly technical blockchain and development workshops. This spring we organized a 3-day hackathon, Lionhack, for students and other builders in the space to help onboard more people to crypto and incubate new projects in the space. We are strong supporters of innovative Defi projects, and we are big believers in Maker DAO. Given our experience in our own DAO’s governance as well as in Uniswap, Compound, and dYdX, we believe that we are strongly equipped to act as a neutral and effective governance delegate for the Maker community. Other governance initiatives involve:  Staying active within discussion forums Drafting new proposals when appropriate Putting out tweet threads on active proposals Building relations with partnering protocols. Hosting speaker events.  Recent Governance activity  DRC: Increase Fee Weight Parameter A Step Towards a More Equitable Liquidity Provider Reward Structure Risk Parameter Updates for 7 Collateral Assets Grant request for launching Compound with Aztec Connect  As a university blockchain organization, we believe governance forums are one of the best ways to foster active learning in web-3. This is why we’re really excited to present our candidacy to work with Maker DAO. Possible Conflicts of Interest  [email protected] takes part actively in the governance of other well known projects  I have read and agree to abide by the Delegate Code of Conduct. content.content: [XSGD] Collateral Onboarding Application (MIP6)  XSGD is a Singapore-dollar backed stablecoin with full fiat collateralization. While it could potentially be beneficial to have a non-USD stablecoin backing DAI as previously stated it’s not worth the opportunity cost on Maker at this time. We are open to onboarding XSGD as market conditions improve. We have worries on the liquidity of this asset as well as its capabilities to generate profitable/sensible amounts of DAI for Maker. [KREDIKA] MIP6 Application At this time, we believe the opportunity cost of adding an additional task to the Real World Asset team isn’t realistic. With a lot of debate regarding the future direction of RWA, we believe that it is more sensible to reach a consensus regarding RWA before onboarding Kredika. Moreover, the issue of DAI value retention arises with RWAs. We also want to see Kredika become more established in the industry due to the risks that onboarding may bring.

content.content: 1/2 Lending Oversight (LOVE-001) Core Unit MIP : YES For this controversial poll, we voted YES for a number of reasons. To first argue for the devil’s advocate, the responsibilities of the proposed LOVE-001 CU overlaps with that of RWF as well as Risk; however, we still see potential benefits of a Lending Oversight Core Unit. @luca_pro has been working behind the scenes for months now for developments regarding RWF as well as Risk and more. The advisory role that LOVE-001 provides is already somewhat present, we hope to make it official and develop this branch of Maker in the future. From other party’s interactions as well as previous track record, we have faith in Luca to lead the CU to the best of his abilities and add an extra layer of checks and balances to Maker. A budget-neutral oversight committee over all the structured finance projects is needed to better manage risk and investments. However, we would not be opposed to expanding the responsibilities of existing CU’s as a substitute. - https://vote.makerdao.com/polling/QmWYajMq MIP4c2-SP20: MIP16 Amendments: YES We voted YES. There wasn’t much contention regarding this topic, we believe that more time for governance teams to draft up changes means better developments and more stability for the protocol in the long term. - https://vote.makerdao.com/polling/Qmerh2xJ MIP40c3-SP69: Modify Core Unit Budget - Strategic Finance (SF-001): Approve Increased budget, Approve existing budget only We approve of a budget increase for SF-001. Maker has a lot of idle funds that can be used to bolster the protocol, and we believe that SF is the best party for this task. There is a bit of hesitation on the hiring end as if more individuals are hired during bull markets, they may become liabilities in the bear. However, we appreciate the detail and changes in the budget regarding different market conditions as outlined by @Aes. - https://vote.makerdao.com/polling/QmVMc78Z MIP40c3-SP70: Modify Growth Core Unit Budget, GRO-001: Approve Increased budget, Approve existing budget only We approve of increasing GRO-001’s budget to the basegrowth option. We believe that branding and growth is integral to any protocol, but especially Maker due to its longevity and lasting impacts. Although the numbers may be a bit skewed for some aspects of the budget, we believe that GRO-001 has a plan for different market conditions to continue to bolster the influence of Maker and DAI. - https://vote.makerdao.com/polling/QmdMkg2N#vote-breakdown MIP41c4-SP34: Facilitator Onboarding (IS-001): ABSTAIN We do not think we have enough interaction with the proposed facilitator to make a decision at this point in time. - https://vote.makerdao.com/polling/QmaR6q4L MIP41c4-SP35: Facilitator Onboarding (DIN-001): ABSTAIN We do not think we have enough interaction with the proposed facilitator to make a decision at this point in time. - https://vote.makerdao.com/polling/QmWhsLCU MIP55c3-SP4: Adding a Special Purpose Fund - Makershire Hathaway: YES We voted YES on Makershire Hathaway. From the forums, we think that a large portion of the community understands Makershire as a form of prop trading instead of “safe” yield farming strategies to increase the presence of DAI on L2s and other chains. With safe strategies (or as safe as you can get in this industry), Makershire’s returns will be somewhat consistent. We highly support the end goal of automating these strategies, but we are concerned with management as the space is constantly changing. Regardless, our discussions with @Aes and other proponents of this poll alleviated our hesitations, and we support this initiative as long as transparency exists and Maker holders still have a say in these strategies. - https://vote.makerdao.com/polling/QmZjU2pG

content.content: Asset Allocation of MIP65/Clydesdale We voted ABSTAIN. At the time of the initial vote regarding the initiative as a whole, we were not present as a delegate. As such, we had no say in the initial proposal. Regarding the allocation of the 500M DAI, we would like to vote Abstain. In practice, the strategies outlined on the forum regarding MIP65 will allow Maker to capitalize on opportunities that current idle assets can provide. In the current climate of rising interest rates, 500M DAI in fairly low-risk, liquid assets will undoubtedly generate yield for Maker. However, we decided to vote abstain as this proposal is a bit contradictory in principle. As a DeFi service, we think that “longing” US bonds goes against the principle of the protocol. Prioritization Sentiment - Technical Resource Deployment - June 6, 2022 We ranked the choices: Compound D3M, Maker Teleport, DssKiln. We believe that D3M in general is revolutionary for the protocol as it expands DAI’s influence in DeFi in addition to another use case for the currency. Even if Compound should be regarded as somewhat of a competitor, collaboration between the two protocols is needed in current market conditions. We ranked Maker Teleport second because an official DAI bridge for other chains will become a high-demand product in the future. Specifically, DAI’s dominance on other chains has slowly been dwindling. Hopefully, Maker Teleport can somewhat increase the presence of DAI throughout different major chains. Lastly, we put DssKiln; however, it is by no means unimportant. As we have previously stated for our votes regarding permissionless open market operations, DssKiln’s development is necessary. The potential of DssKiln and the related operations to improve slippage, efficiently perform transactions, and more can only be reached if there is a focus on further developing the initiative. Prioritization Sentiment - Collateral Class - June 6, 2022 We feel that Peg Stability Solutions, Core Crypto Collateral, and RWA vaults encompass the core products of Maker. Importantly, a focus on these collateral classes expands the use-case for DAI. These are all areas of contention that have the potential to generate substantial revenue and value.

content.content: PPG - Maker Open Market Committee Monthly Recommendation We voted YES. This was pretty much a no-brainer for us. The risk team is well-established and trusted. Their proposed changes are all justified within the proposal. We will be monitoring the vaults as well. Building Financial Resilience & DAO Targets We voted for Negative (Minimum 3 years runway at any time) as our first choice and Break-even (Plus-minus 5%) as our second. Operating at a loss for some time will be beneficial to Maker’s growth in the long-term despite short-term costs. We are not opposed to the Break-even choice as well. However, we do believe that clarified metrics for evaluating CU productivity is needed. HVB Onboarding We voted YES. Both parties have aligned interest in achieving the maximum sustainable yield. Both parties also benefit as a result of this proposal in yield and returns for Maker as well as a higher lending limit for HVB. We trust the time and effort put into this proposal by the RWA team, and we hope that there will be many more to come in the future.

content.content: MIP6: Declaration of Intent – Backed Finance (Discussion) YES - The introduction of short-term bonds into MakerDAO is something that we’ve been looking forward to for a while now. However, we have a few concerns as shared by other members of the community. Although Backed Finance has answered multiple questions regarding the legal aspects of this proposal, we are still wary of regulatory pressure of onboarding a tokenized US Security. Regardless, if the worst case scenario (from our understanding through the forum) is a 1-1 redemption of the underlying bonds due to stringent regulations, we feel as if this is fairly low-risk especially if the legal and security concerns are ironed out. We hope to see bIBTA’s PSM come into fruition soon despite the RWA internal restructuring. We will continue to monitor the process as we have reservations noted above. Tactical Reallocation Process for Budget Adjustments (Discussion) ABSTAIN - Since responsibilities and market conditions are always changing, it makes sense that the budget for CUs does too as their amount of work changes. As such, we support a tactical reallocation of funds rather than percentage cut in principle. However, we voted abstain due to a number of reasons:  From our understanding, the time-sensitive nature of this proposal may result in rushed KPIs and goals/responsibilities for CUs. 3 KPIs for each CU – with a max of 5 – may be too much to follow, resulting in unknowledgeable voting on critical areas of Maker growth. While a tracker for KPIs (similar to the governance dashboard) assists with the organization of these KPIs, we are still wary of Maker holders’ and delegates’ abilities to be completely up to date. We also do not support a broad-based percentage cut as we believe that budgets need to be flexible and reflect changing conditions. They need to be re-evaluated on a regular basis. UPDATE: We don’t think that these two are the only solutions to the budget adjustment problem that Maker has arrived at. Specifically, we urge others to look at the new post by @Juan on project-based budgeting.  Maker Teleport on Starknet (Discussion) YES - We support expanding Maker/DAI into a quickly-growing Ethereum rollup. DAI’s presence on Layer-2’s has been fairly minimal; however, the market share has increased in the past month. We see this proposal as another means to increase the liquidity and influence of DAI into different ecosystems. Noting the success of DAI expansions on Arbitrum and Optimism, we have confidence in SECU and PECU and their abilities. However, there are reservations that still persist. The bridge brings a lot of risk with the tx oracle as well as the amount of trust Maker puts in third parties. Jumping on an early opportunity to capitalize on a growing rollup is enticing; however, we would like to see a risk and legal framework being further developed in the near future prior to launch. PPG - Open Market Committee Proposal (Discussion) ABSTAIN - Following the aftermath of the 3AC contagion, many CeFi protocols have blown up as well – some directly as a result of 3AC, others as a result of market conditions. As such, it’s clear that their risk assessments and capacity is different from that of DeFi protocols. However, the lowering of vault fees to incentivize demand is a two-sided sword in our view. DeFi lending and borrowing has dramatically decreased in the past months, lowering fees may not be enough for market participants to become risk-on. Moreover, with Maker’s budget discussions currently going on, we consider the reduction in revenue to be somewhat substantial. Moreover, we believe that other incentives can exist such as Maker Rewards capped at “X” amount – an idea visited a couple of weeks ago.

content.content: MIP6: Pando Investment Grade Climate Assets Collateral Onboarding (Discussion) - ABSTAIN It was extremely hard for us to make a yes or no decision on this proposal. Discussion amongst ourselves led to a standstill, and reading the points brought up by DAO contributors and delegates could not break this standstill. In the end, we decided to abstain as we support the principle/heart of this proposal but cannot, in good conscience, support its parameters. We support the idea and intention behind the proposal for a number of reasons. 1. Pando’s investment grade solar loans is a form of clean money that speaks to the potential of MakerDAO and DeFi as a whole in the real world. The partnership would be more than simply just a government bond as is the case with other RWA. This is a further step towards pushing the industry into mainstream attention, gathering positive publicity for the protocol and industry. 2. From Pando’s responses, it’s clear that a lot of time and effort has been put into alleviating MakerDAO’s concerns on the risk of these loans. A. We understand that there is a very low-risk of default. Investment-grade entities default at a historic rate of 0.03% - 0.3%. B. Even in the scenario where multiple homes default, Pando posits that they, with others, would be able to absorb around 1900 loans out of a pool of 5000. This means that approximately 38% of homes will need to default in order for Maker’s return to be impacted as noted by @Dori. C. Pando further says that the loans will be liquid enough for MakerDAO to offload in an liquidation event. Institutions and other entities are already buying up these bonds, and it’s expected that 3 months would be enough to liquidate said assets. From a RWA point of view, the liquidity of these loans shouldn’t be a problem. With that being said, there are a number of concerns that we have with the conditions of this proposal.  The solar loans have a weighted-average-life (WAL) of 6 years with a 14-year maturity. These time horizons are longer than Maker itself. As such, we don’t think that we can truly gauge the risk involved with a transaction of this size and length. However, this risk will need to be taken in the future as the protocol scales. Compared to crypto-native assets, these loans are considered illiquid. A verbal guarantee of these loans being able to be liquidated isn’t enough considering the size of the transaction. Even compared to other RWA, solar loans are less illiquid as well from our point of view. This raises another question of how much of Maker’s balance sheet should be RWA; however, this is a topic for another day. We’d like to see further downside protection. For instance, clauses where transactions are only brought forward after a certain condition is met. The yield generated from these loans is lower than the yield that Maker can obtain through other assets. The transaction yields approximately 2.9% or lower compared to 5% for other A loans with more protection for MakerDAO as expressed in the forum discussion.  We would like to reiterate that we are not opposed to this transaction due to the loans themselves or Pando Climate Inc. Rather, we think that the conditions are not too favourable for MakerDAO at this time; however, we would like to see these discussions be continued when RWF CU is cleared up as well. As such, we have decided to abstain for this vote.

content.content: MIP40c3-SP73: Modify Core Unit Budget (EVENTS-001) (Discussion) NO - While the onboarding process of this core unit was unconventional, we still feel that there is a need for events in order to increase Maker’s publicity. At the current moment, we do not support this proposal for a number of reasons:   The Events CU was on-boarded a bit less than 4 months ago – not enough time to gauge their success or impact in our opinion. In this time, they have organized multiple events for different conferences.   Events are not limited to only parties. We think that the mandate of the Events CU includes hackathons, conferences, and more. We would like the CU to properly expand their operations before making an offboarding decision.   Events CU acknowledges their high budget of ~900,000 DAI. As such, they’ve proposed initiatives to reduce this budget such as cost-splitting with other protocols, actively looking for ways to reduce the CU’s budgetary pressure on the DAO.   As per @PonJerry’s post on the forum. Offboarding Events CU saves ~150,000 DAI instead of the entire ~900,000 DAI budget.   Events are necessary in order for Maker and DAI to increase their brand recognition. Even as a cornerstone of DeFi, marketing and education is needed. Events are a medium to do so and are more than necessary with the proliferation of stablecoins in the industry.   There are currently discussions surrounding the CU offboarding framework. We think it’s only fair to conclude these discussions prior to any offboardings at the moment.   We would be open to a few ideas/changes raised in the discussion.  Budgetary constraints as ~900,000 DAI is a bit much in our view as well. However, we understand that hosting events takes somewhat of an “all-or-nothing” type of mentality in order to make a lasting impact. Transparency on the operations of the CU is needed. This can include regular updates on the current projects of the CU, data collection on events turnout, potential partnerships, etc. We’d like a clear roadmap of what types of events will be hosted in the future with an approximate timeline as well. Many good ideas on possible events were given in the discussion. We’d like to see these come into fruition. A possible merger between Events, Growth and PR, and Strategic Happiness. We agree that some of the responsibilities between these CUs overlap. As such, we would not be opposed to exploring a possible merger between the three or a combination of the three to reduce spending.  We appreciate @PonJerry’s professionalism throughout this process. All in all, we don’t think that enough time has been given for events to showcase what they can provide. MIP4c2-SP15: Core Unit Offboarding Process Amendments (Discussion) YES - We support this additional framework to the offboarding process. We believe that it provides clarity and organization to offboarding proposals as well as improving the information asymmetry that currently exists. We support any clear initiative that will help streamline this process. MIP4c2-SP23: MIP50 Direct Deposit Module Amendment (Discussion) YES - Pretty much a no-brainer for us. We supported the first iteration of D3M. We support an amendment to generalize the operations so that it extends beyond AAVE. MIP40c3-SP74: Modify Dai Foundation Core Unit Budget, DAIF-001 (Discussion) Bear Scenario, Base - While we are leaning towards the Super Bear scenario due to current market and macro conditions, we are not very knowledgeable about Intellectual property laws. As such, we’ve decided in favour of the Bear scenario proposed by the DAI Foundation. As stated by the CU facilitator, it’s better to be safe than sorry in the case of an IP attack. We support a slight reduction in the DAI foundation budget so that they’re able to normally continue their operations with some flexibility. MIP40c3-SP75: Modify Oracle Core Unit Budget, ORA-001 (Discussion) Approve Proposed Budget - We appreciate the CU proactively looking for ways to reduce their spending. We agree with the sentiment that security should not be outsourced. Many exploits, such as Blizz Finance during the $LUNA crash, occur due to oracle and security responsibilities being outsourced. We support the reduction in budget especially if it means that the CU will continue with their operations similar to before. We would like to see more discussion on the changes to the vesting or compensation parameters of the protocol as a whole in the future. MIP76: Makershire Redux (Discussion) YES - We supported Makershire from its inception as one of our first votes. Despite this, we shared concerns with the community on the security and allocation of the proposal. We appreciate the amendments made by the SF CU. While Maker’s governance may be convoluted at times, we are grateful that all aspects of risk is covered within a proposal, specifically the multi-sig concern in the previous Makershire proposal. The proposed strategies, although less yield than volatile assets, alleviates the risk of impermanent loss with stables and is a safe investment (as safe as it can get in this space). While external party risks (multi-sig, admin key, defaults, etc.) still exist as noted by @monet-supply, we are willing to take these risks due to their lower likelihood with the proposed strategies. The 10 million DAI is allocated across different chains, further reducing the risk of a counterparty compromise. Moreover, since the proposal can be reassessed after 12 months, we think that this is an extremely beneficial “trial” that utilizes currently idle funds.

content.content: Greenlight Polls: RWA Arranger (BlockTower Credit) (Discussion, Portal) ABSTAIN - It’s great to see BlockTower taking an active interest in MakerDAO through their arranger application after their continued participation in Maker through the past few years. Although our final decision is to abstain, this will change as time progresses. Our reasoning is as follows: From our understanding, the arranger model has been debated on in the past regarding RWAs, specifically whether or not it is necessary for the DAO’s success. In the perfect scenario, we think that there is more efficiency in working directly with the lending counterparty rather than through an arranger model. As we have already seen shortcomings and obstacles in onboarding RWA as collateral, we understand that there is somewhat of a need for an arranger. Additionally, others have voiced the concern of a lack of oversight regarding an arranger. As there are current shortcomings and deadlocks in governance, we think that ironing these issues out first would be more beneficial. Regardless, We have faith that both BlockTower Credit and Centrifuge will put Maker interests first with lower-risk collateral ; however, we cannot wholeheartedly support the greenlight given current circumstances. As the poll will be passing due to majority support. We will continue to keep up to date with developments and reach a consensus on this topic later on. Cabot (Cabot Renewable Energy Crypto Mining LLC) (Discussion, Portal) NO - Clean energy may be a beneficial mandate for MakerDAO in terms of optics; however, we are unsure whether it or not it needs to be. From our view, there are more pressing issues and scalability decisions for Maker than clean energy. Moreover, most of Maker’s collateral follows BTC and crypto markets. Expansion into RWA’s is supposed to diversify this risk; onboarding Cabot means that the underlying assets will be correlated with the crypto market as well. We are also concerned with liquidity issues and finding buyers in a liquidation event. Due to these reasons, we will not be supporting this poll at this time. DDC (Detox Digital Coin) (Discussion, Portal) NO - Our sentiment for both greenlight polls are the same. While different concerns exist for DDC, we don’t believe that there has been enough discussion. This is not the fault of the counterparty but rather the RWA CU reorganization currently taking place. We’d like to have internal clarity prior to moving forward – a concern for both Cabot and DDC. PPG - Open Market Committee Proposal (Discussion, Portal) Option 2 - We support lowering the stability fees in order to increase DAI liquidity and dominance. Ratification Poll for Legal Domain Work on Greenlit Collateral (bIBTA) Special Purpose Fund (MIP55c3-SP6) (Discussion, Portal) YES - Regardless of the underlying collateral (which we originally supported), we’d like the onboarding process to be as efficient as possible. We understand that there’s some contention regarding the mandate of Strategic Finance in overseeing the legal domain of this partnership. While we do not agree with how these responsibilities were delegated behind closed doors, we do not see a reason to prolong the process more. HVBank Drawdown, Maker Teleport Launch on Optimism and Arbitrum (Portal) - August 31, 2022 YES - We are supporting the HVBank drawdown and Maker Teleport on Optimism and Arbitrum as voiced previously.

There is an additional centralization risk coupled with the point above that we do not think is beneficial to Maker. The DAO has been long supporters of Maker, and we would like to see the partnership evolve. We hope to see the auction process become more efficient for all parties involved as a result of these changes. However, we would strongly like to revisit this proposal when the organizational issues have been resolved. Executive: Update the PROXY_ACTIONS_END_CROPPER Address, Starknet Bridge Deposit Limit Increase, Core Unit MKR Vesting - September 28, 2022 YES - Supporting due to previous reasonings

content.content: Approve Multisig for Management of Velodrome NFT - October 3, 2022 YES - No real reason from our team for this to be a no. A multisig will direct the rewards directly back to the Maker community and drive liquidity to Maker-aligned pairs. PPG - Open Market Committee Proposal - October 3, 2022 YES - Agree with the risk team’s analysis of market conditions and updating parameters based on said conditions. Community Greenlight Poll - ANCHORAGE (Anchorage Lending Crypto Mining) - October 3, 2022 Because of the ongoing restructuring/issues with RWA, it’s not a good time to onboard. Can be reconsidered when internal organizational structure is fixed. Executive: Monetalis Clydesdale (RWA007-A) Onboarding, Funding Ambassador Program SPF, Core Unit MKR Streams and Transfers - October 5, 2022 YES - We support the new vault onboarding and Monetalis’ continued partnership with Maker, the additional DAI for ambassadors, and the respective Maker for CUs. MIP10c9-SP31: Proposal to whitelist Oasis.app on rETHUSD Oracle YES - Oasis has the widest on-chain liquidity pool for the ETH/DAI market, hence whitelisting Oasis will onboard new users, increasing the access for rETH/USD. While there is a oracle concern, we trust the oracle team and their due diligence. Change PSM-GUSD-A Parameters - October 10, 2022 YES -  The adjustment is clearly a response to the GUSD and MakerDAO marketing incentive and partnership that favours PSM vaults. From a macro lens, the change will decrease the  reliance on USDC as well as gain interest from Gemini for Maker. End DAI Funding For Sourcecred YES -  Onboarding and elevating community members to participate in the Maker ecosystem is crucial for governance and enables checks and balances. The question to be asked is are there better alternatives (community) and how do we implement a system that prevents abusive behaviors while providing governance mining incentives. We hope to see GovAlpha’s next iteration of an incentive system to top that of Sourcecred in its early days. MOMC Guidance - Remove ETH Supply Yield And Liquidity Incentives From D3M Target Borrow Rate Calculations - October 10, 2022 As market conditions change, it makes sense for the Aave D3M to be updated as well given that the supply rate changed. We support the recommendations based on the calculations for this proposal MOMC Guidance - Allowed Spread Between D3M Target Borrow Rate And ETH-A Stability Fee October 10, 2022 Option 1 - 0.5%, Option 2 - 0% We support a target spread of 0.5% with its respective conditions as it provides a window for change and helps Maker keep up with Aave. While revenue is lower compared to 0%, we hold more importance in DAI adoption and don’t think that the spread should be 0% as of now.

content.content: Ratification Poll for Endgame Prelaunch MIP Set - October 10, 2022 NO - While some of the Endgame changes may be beneficial, we do not agree with batching these proposals together (more detailed explanation regarding endgame as a whole to come) Ratification Poll for Offboarding the Strategic Happiness Core Unit - SH-001 (MIP39c3-SP3) - October 10, 2022 YES - While we think that it is fairly early to offboard the Strategic Happiness CU, we understand that this is somewhat of a given due to the Endgame plan and Maker’s governance shortcomings. We support this proposal as it contains a traditional “Golden Parachute” clause. However, we would like to emphasize and hope that this will not set a precedent for vested MKR to be immediately available. Ratification Poll for Offboarding the Events Core Unit - EVENTS-001 (MIP39c3-SP4) - October 10, 2022 YES - Similar reasoning as above. Ratification Poll for Offboarding the Real-World Finance Core Unit - RWF-001 (MIP39c3-SP5) - October 10, 2022 and Ratification Poll for Facilitator Offboarding - RWF-001 (MIP41c5-SP12) - October 10, 2022 YES to both. Regardless of future protocol changes, we think that this offboarding has been a long time coming. We understand that Will has been a key contributor to Maker for quite some time; however, the offboarding is justified given the events that have transpired throughout the year. While the blame does not solely rest on Will, the divisiveness of the RWF CU has not helped Maker’s already convoluted structure. Additionally, with the onboarding of many different RWA vaults, a clearer mandate and better communication are needed for the Maker party responsible Ratification Poll for Coinbase USDC Institutional Rewards (MIP81) - October 10, 2022 and Ratification Poll for Monetalis-Coinbase Appaloosa (MIP82) - October 10, 2022 YES - Currently, the asset within the PSM is sitting idle, even if 1.5% may not be the highest, we support a partnership with an established player of the industry although centralized. We understand that there’s a certain stigma around Maker’s decentralization and stance by partnering with Coinbase as noted by some members of the community but the rewards in both yield as well as exposure are worth the risk in our opinions. We would like to see more information on operations from Coinbase’s end as it is a large sum. Additionally, continued monitoring of the position and its liquidity is needed as well. However, we do note the counterparty risks involved with these proposals. Ratification Poll for Legal And Commercial Risk Domain Work on Greenlit Collateral BlockTower Credit - RWA Arranger SPF (MIP55c3-SP9) - October 10, 2022 YES - We support allocating additional funds for the legal work as it is a necessary part of their responsibilities. Ratification Poll for Facilitator Offboarding Process (MIP41c5) adjustments (MIP4c2-SP26) - October 10, 2022 YES - Voting yes on this poll as it provides a more efficient and clear process for offboarding facilitators. Also in support of further discussions regarding replacement facilitators. Executive: Enable DC-IAM for RWA-007-A (Monetalis Clydesdale), GUSD PSM Parameter Changes - October 13 , 2022 Supporting the parameter upgrades to Monetalis Clydesdale and parameter changes to the GUSD PSM. We do not see a reason to disagree. Collateral Auction Parameter Changes, MOMC Parameter Adjustments, Recognized Delegate Compensation for September - October 14, 2022 Supporting this executive as we have agreed with each of the underlying polls. rETH Technical Onboarding, Enable Starknet DAI Bridge Fees - October 26, 2022 Supporting the pre-approved parameters for Maker Teleport on Starknet and the rETH vault.

content.content: Activate Liquidations for Stablecoin Vaults to Clear Bad Debt - October 31, 2022 YES - Regardless of the amount of bad debt that the vaults in question holds, we believe that it is both in the protocols best interest as well as responsibility to clear up this debt. While it may be simply an accounting issue and not a priority, we see no harm in clearing this debt up now quickly. One Month Budget Extension for Strategic Happiness Core Unit - October 31, 2022 NO - While we appreciate all the work that SHCU has done, we don’t think that it’s correct for Maker to issue an extension. The CU would be offboarded by then, and we agree with the argument that these costs should’ve been noted within the original proposal as voiced by other delegates. We would not be opposed to project-specific budget allocations in special circumstances such as this in the future. PPG - Open Market Committee Proposal - October 31, 2022 YES - We support reducing Maker’s exposure to riskier vaults through the noted parameter changes. Excited for another D3M that brings additional yield to Maker to be rolled out; in agreement with starting it small and hopefully increasing later on. Add the Compound V2 DAI Direct Deposit Module (D3M) - November 7, 2022 YES - Given the success of Maker’s previous D3M, we support adding this new D3M. Given current market conditions, we understand and agree with the proposed parameters, but we hope to revisit in the future. Stablecoin Vault Liquidation Parameters and Auction Activation - November 14, 2022 YES - Supporting this poll as an extension of the related previous poll. We believe that the clearance of bad debt (USDC-A and USDP-A vaults) is a responsible measure. While there are no current GUSD-A vaults that are above the collateral ratio, we believe that it is fitting to impose liquidation measures on these vaults as the DAO continues to monitor market conditions. Executive: Budget Stream Housekeeping For Offboarded Core Units, Oracle Whitelist Addition, SPF Funding - November 02, 2022 Voting for this executive as we’ve voiced our support for each previously. Urgent Collateral Parameter Changes - November 12, 2022 Supporting this executive and its proposed parameter changes given current market conditions as well as the contagion effects that may arise as a result of result events.

content.content: Stablecoin Vault Liquidation Parameters and Auction Activation - November 14, 2022 YES - Due to current market conditions, we believe that the clearance of bad debt (USDC-A and USDP-A vaults) is a responsible measure. While there are no current GUSD-A vaults that are above the collateral ratio, we believe that it is fitting to impose liquidation measures on these vaults as the DAO continues to monitor market conditions. Ratification Poll for Immunefi Security Core Unit (IS-001) Facilitator Onboarding (MIP41c4-SP38) - November 14, 2022 NO - This proposal is a repeat of a failed April proposal. We agree with @LongForWisdom’s rationale for voting against the measure. Budget Ratification Poll for Modify Development and UX Core Unit (DUX-001) Budget (MIP40c3-SP82) - November 14, 2022 New-Base, Existing - We appreciate the changes that the DUX team have pushed recently, such as the gas-less poll voting integration. Given the current industry outlook as well as their past spending habits, we think that that the new-base option is sufficient for the team. However, given Maker’s strategic shift into the Endgame framework, we are expecting a significant change in workload. Ratification Poll for CoinShares Active Treasury Management (MIP86) - November 14, 2022 NO - We vote in alignment with the vast majority on this proposal. Using external asset managers is beyond protocol risk tolerance, even if CoinShares has demonstrated their worth over the last bull market. Ratification Poll for OUSD Decentralized Rewards (MIP87) - November 14, 2022 NO - This proposal exposes the DAO to many risk factors that would trump the reward. In addition to risk concerns presented by @rema, we would like to emphasize OUSD’s declining active user base and market dominance (https://analytics.ousd.com/). We cannot deposit $100m in exchange for illiquid assets and heavy penalties in case of withdrawal. More importantly, the DAO is looking for responsible opportunities to enhance its revenue, not making risky “seed round” bets described by Origin’s team. Ratification Poll for Modify Immunefi Security Core Unit (IS-001) Mandate (MIP39c2-SP38) - November 14, 2022 and Budget Ratification Poll for Modify Immunefi Security (IS-001) Budget (MIP40c3-SP83) - November 14, 2022 NO and Reject Budget - We are not in support of this change given the next phase of Maker’s development and the role that Immunefi will play. Further, we are unsure of the necessity of having Immunefi’s responsibilities be a separate CU. Budget Ratification Poll for Modify Governance Communications Core Unit DAI Budget, COM-001 (MIP40c3-SP84) - November 14, 2022 Approve reduced budget - We are inclined to support the limited budget reduction (86% of original) as a response to worsening market conditions and incentive standards accepted by the DAO. Budget Ratification Poll for Modify Sidestream Auction Services Core Unit DAI Budget, SAS-001 (MIP40c3-SP85) - November 14, 2022 Reject Budget - We would like to reject the majority of core unit funding proposals that don’t include sufficient reasoning for the funding. @Llama makes a good point in that these could be additions run externally. Budget Ratification Poll for Modify TechOps Core Unit DAI Budget, TECH-001 (MIP40c3-SP86) - November 14, 2022 Abstain - We are abstaining from this poll as we are unsure of the complete KPIs of the TechOps CU as well as possible changes in responsibilities going into Endgame. Due to the necessity/control of this CU over other parts of Maker, we think that a rejection would be too harsh. Ratification Poll for Modify Emulated Surplus Buffer Upper Limit (MIP84c10-SP1) - November 14, 2022 NO - We vote in alignment with the vast majority of holders that voted. MakerDAO should not be expanding into off-chain assets. We support a risk-free approach. Ratification Poll for Monetalis - Redwood Friesian (MIP88) - November 14, 2022 No - We don’t support high ask amount of this proposal. This, in addition to the greater exposure to counterparty risk is our reasoning. Ratification Poll for Monetalis - Arrow Andalusian (MIP89) - November 14, 2022 NO - Due to current market conditions, we believe the DAO needs to conduct further due diligence when evaluating proposals of this scale especially with the high counterparty risk that subsequent Monetalis proposals may include. Regardless of reputation, diversification is important. Budget Ratification Poll for Modify the Sustainable Ecosystem Scaling Core Unit DAI Budget, SES-001 (MIP40c3-SP87) - November 14, 2022 Approve standard option budget - After core units are deprecated, there will need to be further restructuring to the SES that makes this budget change unnecessary until further action needed. Stablecoin Vault Liquidation Parameters and Auction Activation - November 14, 2022 YES - We support the effort to clean up legacy bad debt. We vote in favor of this proposal.

content.content: Decrease GUSD PSM Fee Out (tout) - January 16, 2023 and Adjust the GUSD PSM Debt Ceiling - January 16, 2023 NO - After speaking with the Gemini team and reading over responses from their end, we think that the concerns surrounding GUSD are somewhat overstated. Given that Gemini has met their end of the pre-established partnership (increasing revenue for Maker in a time where revenues across the sector are decreasing) and the legal oversight over Gemini, we would like to keep the PSM as is. Additionally, the concerns by the community over GUSD is justified, but we don’t believe that these changes will significantly decrease Maker’s exposure. Ratification Poll for Amend MIP51 to Remove MIP51c4 (Calendar Exceptions) (MIP4c2-SP28) - January 9, 2023 YES - It’s important to adapt to important developments regardless of the time. content.content: ONESTONE Key Info Delegate Address: 0x9301F3bB7A71Ab4d46b17BD1F8254142fa8F26AD Forum: @TRUEMAKER Discord: @TRUEMAKER#4772 Email: [email protected] Meet Your Delegate Video: TBA Core Values   Growth: I am in support of initiatives that enable broader DAI adoption and that attempt to reduce concentration risks, such as USDC reliance. The DAI peg is important to my platform; as a stablecoin, we must comply with DAI holders’ expectations.  Revenue: Developing core, complementary products to ensure that revenue is stable, not seasonal, and attempting to eliminate market-driven volatility from the DAO’s bottom line. To achieve this, we need strong ALM, RWF and DAI use cases.  Data-Driven: With core products (PSM, Vault Lending, RWF, DAI L1/L2 adoption) running smoothly, MKR has a trove of data and bandwidth to test new features and products to remain competitive and innovative.  Unbiased: I participate in open discussions and working sessions from all MakerDAO participants, while practicing and promoting disciplined productivity. Initiatives such as Proof Of Humanity or Gitcoin Passport will be seen positively by my platform.  Delegate Statement My objective for becoming a delegate is to support growth initiatives that will lead to broader DAI adoption and bring value to MKR token holders. I view product rollouts, innovative ideas and DAI adoption (i.e., expanding DAI use cases) very favorably.  By expanding DAI use cases and therefore DAI holders, we benefit from potential organic revenue growth. In addition, we support MakerDAO in its mission to turn DAI into the main digital currency, while maintaining its core values as unbiased, decentralized and asset-backed. The DAO’s mission can only be accomplished with a healthy liquidity buffer that will enable it to experiment, test and adapt to a rapidly changing world. Another key aspect of my objective in becoming a delegate is my passion for financial education and equitable access. While TradFi thrives on uninformed participants and limited availability of products (i.e., the privileged few with resources and connections), MakerDAO can support users new to the financial system by using data-based lending services to offer transparent products and prices. In addition, via MakerDAO’s forum, we provide crypto education and a welcoming community to existing and new users.  I believe MakerDAO’s product should remain accessible and fair to all participants, even if that is at the expense of potential revenue growth; we should be able to develop opportunities that all can access because in the long-run, that will be better for user adoption and growth. I grew up in an Emerging Market, where I witnessed firsthand the impact of fiscally irresponsible and corrupt governments on hard-working communities. These feelings of injustice and experiences in my childhood led me to pursue a career in financial services.  My background in TradFi (capital markets at large, global banks) and as a small business owner gives me the knowledge necessary to participate in finance, sales, marketing and product management-related governance polls for MakerDAO. In addition, with my persistent curiosity, I educate myself on topics relevant to the DAO. My past posts and comments should allow you to understand my vision for the protocol, such as growth in DAI demand, sound ALM business practices, new features for revenue-generation, analysis of market opportunities (L1/L2, Argentina and El Salvador) and innovation for the flagship product (crypto-backed loans). In my view, the key to DAI’s success is to successfully diversify DAI’s collateral, use cases, counterparties and holders. To the extent another MakerDAO community member aligns with my views, I would be happy to consider partnering as a delegate team. To demonstrate my alignment with the protocol, I would invest the majority of any DAI compensation earned as a delegate back into MKR. Code of Conduct As a delegate, I commit to abide by the protocol’s code of conduct and to provide dedication, respect and transparency to the entire MKR community. Conflicts of Interest I own ETH, MKR and other ERC20 tokens, which in aggregate represent less than 10% of my assets. I am not financially compensated by any other crypto project; if that changes (which I do not expect it to), I will inform the protocol in this post. I do not derive income from any potential partner or competitor of MakerDAO. Waiver of Liability By delegating to me, you acknowledge and agree that I participate on a best efforts basis and will not be liable for any form of damages related to my participation in the Maker Protocol or MakerDAO.

The author outlines their core values, objectives, and background, and commits to abiding by the protocol's code of conduct. The post could receive positive feedback, constructive criticism, or questions from third parties, and the author is open to collaboration with other MakerDAO community members.

content.content: Votes Cast October 17 2022 Ratification Poll for Endgame Prelaunch MIP Set - October 10, 2022 (thread) Voted: Yes  Value: Growth  and Risk  Excited to support the evolution of the DAO via the end game. It is an important exercise to perform self-assessment of existing process and make tough decisions such as this one to adapt to change and ensure DAI’s success. Like any plan, it will most likely need to be revised as the new model sets in, especially around the new operating model and MetaDAOs tokenomics. Overall the end game strengthens DAI’s resilience and sets a strategy for collateral that Maker was lacking in its current form Ratification Poll for Offboarding the Strategic Happiness Core Unit - SH-001 (MIP39c3-SP3) - October 10, 2022 (thread) Voted: Yes  Value: Community  Supporting this offboarding that has been improved from the prior version, providing the CU (a long standing member of the community) with offboarding compensation similar to what has been offered in other offboardings. Ratification Poll for Offboarding the Events Core Unit - EVENTS-001 (MIP39c3-SP4) - October 10, 2022 (thread) Voted: Yes  Value: Community  Unfortunately, the timing of this CU’s onboarding could not have been any worse. The market took a nose dive and the liquidations pushed the protocol to operate at a negative on a going forward basis with the existing budget. For that reason this offboarding is unfortunate because the quality of the work, even during offboarding discussions, has been top notch but needed to return to profitability. This is an important lesson to not inflate our work force during bull runs and instead look to expand existing CU (MetaDaos in the end game) or operate on a project basis. Ratification Poll for Offboarding the Real-World Finance Core Unit - RWF-001 (MIP39c3-SP5) - October 10, 2022 (thread) Voted: Yes  Value: Community  Unfortunately the RWA vision failed due to lack of leadership vision, communication and internal toxicity. Its disappointing that the RWF ended this way, especially due to the quality of the work and due diligence process seemed exceptional, the culprit in my opinion was more in terms of setting a clear synergy between DAI and real world assets that MKR would target. In the end game this seems to be resolved (clean energy focus). This initiative has strong CU, community and delegate support due to the monetization of our large USDC position with a highly reputable counterparty. Even though the setup is not 100% trustless, the custodial arrangement is acceptable (low risk) and can be improved upon. The limited effort required to execute this proposal and generate millions of DAI is a no brainer, win-win situation for Maker and Coinbase. content.content: Votes Cast January 20 2023 Before diving into this week’s polling, we wanted to promote our incentivized program we are launching. If you are an MKR holder looking to earn a return on your MKR and don’t have the time to engage in Maker’s governance process, our delegate platform is a great option. We are testing kickbacks as a way to increase our total delegated MKR and voting participation, giving you the chance to maximize your rewards and make the most of your MKR. For more details, please contact us directly. Polls Ratification Poll for Amend MIP61 to tighten up Recognized Delegate Participation Metrics (MIP4c2-SP29) - January 9, 2023 (thread) Voted: 1st choice: Approve both Value: Community  Both of these changes are necessary to ensure the long-term health and security of Maker. The first proposed change will reward Recognized Delegates for actively participating in on-chain polls, rather than just abstaining. The second proposed change will ensure that Recognized Delegates are engaged in Executive Votes and motivated to take swift action when needed. Ratification Poll for Amend MIP51 to Remove MIP51c4 (Calendar Exceptions) (MIP4c2-SP28) - January 9, 2023 (thread) Voted: No This break is important for the health of the community, creates a time for strategic thinking, and allows the core workforce some downtown to recharge as needed. Ratification Poll for MIP14 Repeal (MIP4c4-SP2) - January 9, 2023 (thread) Voted: No MIP14 may be a useful process for the future, as suggested by Patrick_J’s comments as the protocol prepares for the endgame transition. Ratification Poll for Obsolete MIP Removal (MIP23, MIP28) (MIP4c4-SP3) - January 9, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes This MIP is obsolete and should be removed to keep the MIPs Framework slim Ratification Poll for Remove MIP14c4 (Protocol DAI Transfer Ceiling) (MIP4c2-SP32) - January 9, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes I support this poll to remove the Protocol DAI Transfer Ceiling from MIP14 and allow the Maker Community to more easily access the necessary funds to serve the Maker Protocol Ratification Poll for Core Unit Offboarding (COM-001) (MIP39c3-SP7) - January 9, 2023 (thread) Voted: 1st choice: Approve Offboarding, 60,700 DAI Golden Parachute and 100% Multiplier for retroactive MKR - additional 107,317.50 DAI (CU-preferred) Value: Community  David should be provided with a reasonable and balanced offboarding process for COM-001, including the 100% multiplier for retroactive MKR. This is in the best interest of governance, as we have previously outlined the need for a fair and decent resolution for those leaving the organization. We should ensure David is supported throughout the entire process and hope that he is able to join the protocol as we transition to the endgame Ratification Poll for Requesting Protocol DAI Transfer to fund TechOps CU for February 2023 (MIP14c2-SP1) - January 9, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes I support this proposal to fund the team, critical infrastructure, tools, and services through the month of February and look forward to seeing the budget for the month of March. Ratification Poll for Protocol DAI Transfer to Fund IS-001 from Dec 2022 to May 2023 (MIP14c2-SP2) - January 9, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes I support this proposal as it allows the CU to secure the necessary funding to sustain the team and services through May, allowing for the successful transition to an the endgame Ratification Poll for Commercial Risk and Legal Domain Work to Support SF-001 Expanded Mandate Related to RWAs (MIP55c3-SP12) - January 9, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes SF’s importance in the protocol is undeniable, and it is absolutely critical for them to have the necessary funding to do the necessary commercial risk and legal domain work. This expenditure is essential. Ratification Poll for Special Purpose Fund for developing Proof-of-Performance for Viridian Cluster (MIP55c3-SP13) - January 9, 2023 (thread) Voted: No I agree that there is overlap and competition between SF CU and the Viridian Cluster’s monitoring of RWA among other activities that are part of SF’s CU. Last year’s vote commentary outlined some of the Cluster’s plans for RWA going forward which are encouraging. However, until the role of the Cluster at the protocol is made clearer, we don’t support this SPF request. Ratification Poll for Onboard-Amend Keeper Network - Chainlink Automation (MIP63c4-SP5) - January 9, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes I support this poll because Chainlink Automation provides a reliable, secure, and cost-efficient way to automate smart contracts. Ratification Poll for Declaration of Intent to Develop a Comprehensive On-chain Monitoring Solution for RWA Vaults (MIP13c3-SP13) - January 9, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes We are very enthusiastic about this RWA monitoring proposal. It is essential to have a thorough and extensive risk monitoring strategy, and we are excited to see what solutions are proposed as a result of this. Additionally, it may reduce operational complexity and cost, which could be beneficial for businesses.
