Besides responsibly increasing the size of the extra reserve, it is beneficial to assess the return competency and timing of such capital to the protocol.

Votes Cast March 14 2023 Emergency PSM Changes - March 14, 2023  Recent events have demonstrated the necessity for MakerDAO’s protocol to be able to act swiftly, if required, and adjust away from potential missteps. For instance, a hike in Tin over the weekend could have been beneficial, yet by the time it was implemented, the crisis had stabilized, which caused a missed opportunity. Now that the crisis is mostly over and inflows might reverse, it would be beneficial have the capability to adjust parameters more rapidly to prevent undesirable and potentially disastrous results.

Votes Cast March 21 2023 PSM Parameter Normalization - March 20, 2023 (thread) Voted: 1st choice: Reject Options I acknowledge that option 1 is directionally correct, but I think that voting to reject the proposal is the right decision. Even though the proposed parameter changes are in the right direction, they are not enough to effectively diversify the stablecoin reserves. USDC still holds the majority of the reserve (7B cap vs 1b) and the proposed changes do not address the potential illiquidity of the smaller stablecoins. Additionally, PSM fees are applied for smaller illiquid stablecoins and without adding additional PSMs, the main risks remain in the US banking system via uninsured deposits. Therefore, I suggest voting to reject the proposal as it does not sufficiently address the main concerns. Short Ratification Poll for RWA Foundation Broker Onboarding & Expensing for Professional Services (MIP58c4-SP1) - March 20, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes Yes, I support MIP58c4-SP1 as it will provide the Maker Protocol with a new prime broker, as well as legal and accounting fees for the RWA Foundation, which will help with the long-term sustainability of the Maker Protocol.

Blockchain at Berkeley Delegate Profile Delegate Address: 0x7ae109a63ff4dc852e063a673b40bed85d22e585 ENS: calblockchain.eth Email: [email protected] External Website: https://blockchain.berkeley.edu/ Delegation Contract: 0x8F5B93378d59E35799573530A9860597e14b7178  Core Values  Student perspective on MKR ideologies Quantitatively analysis of impact and risk Facilitation of collaboration and community engagement in the Bay Area   Delegate Statement Blockchain at Berkeley is a student organization at UC Berkeley that has been founded since 2014. We actively participates in governance on Uniswap, AAVE, Compound, dYdX and Optimism, and we are expanding our governance focus to more protocols. We are experienced in DeFi mechanism and protocol design and we are very interested in the Maker system. We believe that a fast-growing protocol needs a diverse team of delegates and continuous nourishment of the next generation of designers and developers. Blockchain at Berkeley is in a perfect position to supply talents from the student community to study the latest updates on Maker, and foster engagement to introduce learners to Maker. We want to provide student perspectives to analyze the Maker protocol in a non-partisan and forward-thinking manner, and we aim to make arguments with quantitative justifications on treasury, user experience, risk, etc. We have a track record of creating quality proposals and actively voting on Uniswap, Aave, etc. We created proposal about lowering the minimum proposing threshold on Compound to increase equity and inclusivity for proposal creation (Compound). For more about our justifications for past governance votes, please check our Twitter @CalBlockchain. Blockchain at Berkeley has departments including consulting for leading web3 projects, blockchain education on edX, blockchain accelerator program, and research. We dedicate at least one lead to each protocol and include all governance member to make decisions on all proposals. The governance department meets weekly to discuss the latest updates and presents analysis on proposals. We ensure voices of all members are considered before making a decision. The voting process within the department is democratic to balance knowledge from seasoned members and thoughts from younger members. Our governance initiatives include:  actively engaging in the governance forum to monitor latest protocol changes and risk management creating proposals when we believe an update in the protocol mechanism is needed to better serve Maker facilitating discussions when we find potential protocol risk or correlations risk with latest news testing proposals quantitatively to fact check and ensure proposal efficacy including more internal members to be engaged and learn about the Maker system and building with Maker  We appreciate your consideration for us to be your delegate. We believe that our experience and dedication will greatly compliment the Maker governance team. We are always happy to go in depth with our decision making and analysis so you can be assured that your delegation is efficient in the system.  Conflicts of Interest  We take part in governance of other major protocols including Uniswap, Aave, Compound, and Optimism.  I have read and agree to abide by the Delegate Code of Conduct. Waiver of liability: By delegating to Blockchain at Berkeley, you acknowledge and agree that Blockchain at Berkeley will participate on a best efforts basis and will not be liable for any form of damages related to participation in the Maker Protocol, or MakerDAO.

The stablecoin vaults have shown potential risk to incur bad debt and it is a good time to clear out the risk. PPG - Open Market Committee Proposal - October 31, 2022 Vote: Yes Reasoning: We appreciate the parameter change proposal with the detailed recap of the current status and benefiting changes. We support a proactive take on tuning the parameters to ensure returns maximization and risk minimization. The Compound D3M will bring revenue as tested by Aave D3M and downplaying the inventory of MANA will manage the risk better. We will keep a close eye on the stability fees in the future as well. One Month Budget Extension for Strategic Happiness Core Unit - October 31, 2022 Vote: No Reasoning: We are confused by the goal and motives of the SHCU proposal. The deliverables and impacts are hard to measure and we are looking for better elaboration on the proposal before more consideration.

content.content: Add GNO (GnosisDAO) as a new Vault Type Vote: Yes Reasoning: We are interested to see Maker having a closer partnership with Gnosis chain to support development and dominance of DAI in their market. The proposal can bring synergy between the two protocols to augment mutual benefits. The consistent development of Gnosis can bring more revenue. The stability fee is quite low given the current market conditions, but the 350% liquidation ratio and corresponding 13% liquidation penalty make up. Analysis from Oracle core unit shows risk in price manipulation due to the small volume of GNO. We will pay attention to this when the implementation is ready to be reviewed. Add BlockTower Credit Vault Types Vote: Abstain Reasoning: BlockTower has been a long-time partner with Maker but we are not confident with the previous history of investment efficiency. We have reviewed their MIP90 proposal and asked questions and received satisfying responses to our concerns. The deal is rather complicated and we are unsure that the risk profile the execution work well with the Maker ideologies. We want to have more information to make a decision and decide to abstain. Offboarding Parameters for renBTC Vote: Yes Reasoning: We support the prompt offboarding for renBTC given the current open information of potential insolvency of REN due to the FTX incident. The offboarding parameters look correct and we want to proceed the offboard sooner than later. Proceed with Pre-Implementation Work for the Deal Outlined in MIP90 (BlockTower Liquid AAA Structured Credit and Money Market Fund) - November 21, 2022 Vote: Yes Reasoning: We agree that it will be beneficial for the Strategic Finance core unit to analyze the deal with BlockTower as a due diligence to ensure the integrity of MIP90. As we are supporting MIP90, we want to see the result of further investigation. Ratification Poll for Immunefi Security Core Unit (IS-001) Facilitator Onboarding (MIP41c4-SP38) - November 14, 2022 Vote: No Reasoning: We don’t see the clear need in Immunefi Security Core Unit to onboard another facilitator and as pointed out by the community, we think that the proposer should not submit the same proposal twice when it was failed.

content.content: Budget Ratification Poll for Modify Development and UX Core Unit (DUX-001) Budget (MIP40c3-SP82) - November 14, 2022 Vote: reduced NewBear Reasoning: Given the current market condition, we find the NewBear having the most options to withstand the volatile periods. First of all, we really appreciate the great work from the DUX unit and we love the Arbitrum polling option. We think the NewBear gives sustainable support to the team. Additional workload should be attributed project-wise, so additional hires or contractors should be signed project-by-project, instead of pre-approved in the budget ratification. Budget Ratification Poll for Modify Immunefi Security (IS-001) Budget (MIP40c3-SP83) - November 14, 2022 Vote: Abstain Reasoning: The main expense comes from bug bounties, which is 70+% of the total CU funding in both budget plans. This feels bizarre as we believe that MKR should have a bug bounty program but having a core unit purely serving to reward the whitehats does not feel efficient. We will abstain from the proposal and call for a better integration of the bug bounty in the ecosystem. Ratification Poll for Modify Immunefi Security Core Unit (IS-001) Mandate (MIP39c2-SP38) - November 14, 2022 Vote: No Reasoning: We find the ratification not granting clear deliverables that are under the core unit’s capacity. The bug bounty, incident responses and monitoring and advisory all aim to fill in gaps of various core units, so we suggest an integration of the Immunefi Core Unit with other units, or more creating more achievable and value-adding security service. The current ratification does not refine the existing mandate to add plausible value. Ratification Poll for OUSD Decentralized Rewards (MIP87) - November 14, 2022 Vote: No Reasoning: We are skeptical to the speculation of a token and its tokenomics to earn stable yield. OUSD has an average TVL that is 50% lower than the amount currently asked for. We find the risk level to be high with the practice of another native token and the governance token return model may be unnecessarily complicated with potential of governance tokens. We think that MakerDAO is well-qualified for the same capabilities without relying on another layer of decentralized protocol. We will urge the community to reject the proposal. Ratification Poll for CoinShares Active Treasury Management (MIP86) - November 14, 2022 Vote: Yes Reasoning: We find it important to have more choices of RWA management providers to distribute counter-party risk and test out the efficiency of the provider. The interest model of the treasury management is reasonable and we appreciate the clear custody and transparency measures of CoinShares. The team is experienced and the compliance measure is comparably comprehensive to other solutions. We find value in the future collaboration. Ratification Poll for Modify Emulated Surplus Buffer Upper Limit (MIP84c10-SP1) - November 14, 2022 Vote: Abstain Reasoning: We think we should pay extra caution when using the POVE and the recent surge in RWA exposure was not a part of consideration during the initial MIP84. However, given the risk and changes in the types of assets, we find tuning only the surplus buffer upper limit may be limiting to control the risk and it may introduce other risk dimensions to the POVE as mentioned by other members. Budget Ratification Poll for Modify Sidestream Auction Services Core Unit DAI Budget, SAS-001 (MIP40c3-SP85) - November 14, 2022 Vote: Approve new bear budget Reasoning: We appreciate the work of the auctions UI to support smooth MKR liquidation, multi-channel liquidity, and decentralization. Given the current market condition, we believe that the new bear budget will provide a continuation of the service while being mindful of the constraints. Budget Ratification Poll for Modify TechOps Core Unit DAI Budget, TECH-001 (MIP40c3-SP86) - November 14, 2022 Vote: Approve Reasoning: TechOps is a critical part of MKR operation, so we are approving its continuation in providing the necessary work. The scope of the core unit is clear so we don’t expect additional funding for contractors or hires, so the current budget should be strictly the amount for the upcoming budget cycle. Ratification Poll for Monetalis - Redwood Friesian (MIP88) - November 14, 2022 Vote: No Reasoning: We think the current ask amount of 245M is too high and risky for a provider who doesn’t have experience working with decentralized protocols and structures. We are worried about decentralization and uncertainty about the RMBS program given the large amount. Ratification Poll for Monetalis - Arrow Andalusian (MIP89) - November 14, 2022 Vote: Abstain Reasoning: We are interested in increasing the exposure to the ETF assets, but we are uncertain if Monetalis has the capacity to onboard the large capital amount. With that said, we appreciate Arrow Global’s past experience, compliance, returns, and ESG missions. Budget Ratification Poll for Modify the Sustainable Ecosystem Scaling Core Unit DAI Budget, SES-001 (MIP40c3-SP87) - November 14, 2022 Vote: Approve standard option budget Reasoning: We find value in the SES core unit’s work in developing the endgame plan and more efficient DAO operation. We are unsure about the value output of the speedy operations, since the response of “more development power behind that project” isn’t substantial enough for the additional budget.

content.content: Thanks for the clarification that the OGV portion is coming in the later version than the earlier, currently voted version. We have adjusted our reasoning based on the earlier version.

CalBlockchain:  Thanks for the clarification that the OGV portion is coming in the later version than the earlier, currently voted version. We have adjusted our reasoning based on the earlier version.   The OGV was included in the currently voted on, most up to date version of MIP87. It was not included for financial gain for Maker, but instead to provide Maker the tools to participate in the weekly governance vote for OUSD collateral allocation. All of the voting on MIP87 should have been on the latest version, not on one of the earlier versions.     CalBlockchain:  and the governance token return model may be unnecessarily complicated with potential of governance tokens.   OGV was modeled after Curve Finance’s “ve” governance token model. It is similar in many ways, however, we introduced several improvements. Origin co-founder Josh presented on this at ETH Seoul a few months ago.

content.content: DAI Savings Rate Adjustment - November 28, 2022 Vote: Increase the DSR to 1.0% (1st choice), increase to 0.5% (2nd choice) Reasoning: We believe that increasing DSR is crucial to incentivize the retention in DAI supply and increase integration with other protocols. We are in a good position to have DSR on the table as the revenue-generating RWA and revenue-sharing deals with other projects have matured. We think that increasing DSR is a clear choice, and we refer to  the FED rate hike step 0.75% as the benchmark. We want to make sure that the DSR adjustment will create a measurable impact, so we may be able to do further assessment. As a second choice, we have 0.5% as the conservative measure, which is voted above 0.75% by the club governance team. PPG - Open Market Committee Proposal - November 28, 2022 Vote: Yes Reasoning: We have reviewed the parameter changes for the vaults and approve the risk mitigating approach in fine tuning line and gap. We support the increase of line in stETH with the reduced gap and stability fees, and also the shift of focus in GUSD from USDP to increase return. We agree that no abrupt changes in stability fees will foster community recognition and good faith for maker. Undertake Necessary Risk and Legal Assessments to Increase the NS-DROP Debt Ceiling to 50 Million DAI - November 28, 2022 Vote: Yes Reasoning: We are interested to pursue an increase in the NS-DROP vault with New Silver in an effort to diversify RWA and earn interest. The current information about risk and treasury impact is limited, so we want to consult the analysis from strategic finance core unit to make any decision on the matter.

content.content: Change of Ownership of the Ambassador’s Program Multi-Sig - December 12, 2022 Vote: Yes Reasoning: We support the transition as for procedural matter as a core contributor’s departure. We believe this is necessary for operation and longevity. Dai Foundation Board Member Election Poll - December 12, 2022 Vote: Abstain Reasoning: We don’t have personal interactions with either candidates and cannot testify either’s ability or vision for Dai Foundation. We decide to abstain to leave the decision to the more knowledgeable part of the community. Sidestream Auction Services Core Unit (SAS-001) Funding Request - December 12, 2022 Vote: Yes Reasoning: Given the funding rejection, it is great to see the new objective of the core unit to support endgame plan. We are a bit unsure about the deliverables and funding efficiency, but given the 4-month budget, we think it is worth to continue funding SAS and adjust the decision in four months given the outputs. Governance Communications Core Unit (COM-001) Funding Request - December 12, 2022 Vote: Yes Reasoning: We approve the wind-down spending of the GovComms core unit as it supports the proper offboarding efforts indicated by a previous proposal. Ratification Poll for Pioneer DeFi-focused Language Dataset for the Benefit of Risk Modelling & Governance Communication (MIP55c3-SP11) - December 12, 2022 Vote: No Reasoning: Given the current market downturn and budget conservation, it does not make sense to invest in the proposal that has uncertain economic output. The project could fit better as an independent project and apply for a grant.

content.content: Confirm Trial Deployment of DssKiln - January 9, 2023 Vote: 0.5M Reasoning: Defi market cap has shrunk significantly since the proposal initially passed last June. We see a 3M initial deployment to be premature and believe that the lower amount will make more sense. Still, we agree that the trial deployment should continue regardless of market condition and therefore should not be cancelled. Approve One-time MKR Distribution to Correct CES-001 Incentive Program Shortfall - January 9, 2023 Vote: Yes Reasoning: We want to recover the accounting issue from CES due to historical inaccuracies, so the new team can be on track for their work. In the future, we as the DAO should implement stricter rules for accelerated vesting to avoid this kind of situations. We would only support this type of shortfall once, and expect no such inconsistency should happen again. PPG - Open Market Committee Proposal - January 9, 2023 Vote: Yes Reasoning: We have reviewed the changes and we are in favor of the progressive risk exposure increase. We have implemented extreme caution in the parameters in the past month and given the continuing stability, we should promptly revert some of the changes and supply more liquidity in the market. We also agree that increasing fee structure of stETH and USDP will generate income and disincentivize risky situations.

content.content: RiskDAO  Key Info Delegate Address: 0xD0Df93fC03a7291e31947F5cC6ef526f5B67B0ea Forum: @nonstoptheo, @yaronvel, @eitan_katchka Discord: @nonstopTheo#4780 Email: [email protected] External Website: www.riskdao.org Meet Your Delegate Video: Meet Your Delegate | Ep.20 ft. RISKDAO(aka @nonstopTheo) - YouTube  Delegates Code of Conduct: We as RiskDAO and its core contributors have read, acknowledge and adhere to Maker’s Delegate Code of Conduct. (Agreed 28 September 2022).  Core Values   Rigorous risk frameworks: RiskDAO members think critically about risk factors and attack vectors of DeFi lending protocols. Among other things, we have developed a bad debt dashboard that sheds light into risk management practices of major lending protocols. We will apply this mindset to each and every discussion as a MakerDAO Delegate.  Hands on technical knowledge of the MakerDAO system: the RiskDAO consists of both risk analysts and smart contract developers. Some of the smart contract developers have deep understanding of the MakerDAO dss system, and previously spotted some flaws in the system.  Proactive approach: We think proactively, simulate and analyze potential bugs and exploit vectors before they arise. We don’t want to be called in, when it’s too late but rather point out potential issues before they arise. A recent example is the bug exposure for Moonwell cToken market.  Open source & Collaborative: We work in public and publish code and findings accordingly. We employ a highly collaborative approach with protocols and teams.  Diverse contributor base: We are an international community of contributors with a diverse skill set and have capabilities in smart contract programming, risk analyses, financial services and governance.  Accountability and responsibility: We are fully committed to serving the best interests and needs of MakerDAO, its tokenholders and community. We want to drive protocol growth, whilst minimizing risks to the protocol.  DeFi native: RiskDAO is set up specifically to make users more knowledgeable about how lending markets work, and the risk involved.   Delegate Statement We consider MakerDAO one of the most important DeFi primitives and actively want to shape its future direction. We are aware that protocol governance touches on numerous topics and consider ourselves perfectly suited to add substantial insights and benefits to public debate and decision-making processes. RiskDAO was created in May 2022 by DeFi protocol B.Protocol and by the research arm of 1kx, as the first DAO fully dedicated to creating open source risk management tools for DeFi. Recently, La Tribu, former contributing dev team of the Tribe DAO also started to contribute to the RiskDAO. We have grown rapidly as a DAO and are continuously delivering on our core values. This means we have seen an increase in projects & collaborations, onboarded contributors, published more research to generate insights into strong vs weak system designs.  Previous contribution to the MakerDAO ecosystem:  Tracking MakerDAO’s bad debt in the Bad debt dashboard. B.Protocol team alerted about low dust levels for ETH-A collateral, and provided a detailed analysis, which consequently led to a decision to increase the dust level. B.Protocol’s front end features an interface to the MakerDAO vault system. B.Protocol submitted a collateral on-boarding MIP with an implementation of an alternative liquidation mechanism for MakerDAO. The La Tribu dev team intensively worked on FEI<>DAI integration when it was contributing to the Tribe DAO. B.Protocol did a security audit for a MakerDAO’s smart contract module. In his previous position in 2018, a team member of B.Protocol integrated Kyber Network DEX to aggregate Oasis DEX order book for DAI/ETH orders.   Other contributions to the DeFi ecosystem include:   Bad debt & ETH depegging dashboards Risk parametrization risk analysis for Vesta Finance Market price analysis for multi-layer DeFi scheme Liquidation events simulator Aurigami Dashboard Moonwell bug bounty Joint research with Myso Finance Vesta Finance risk simulation Bounty by Liquity for their Chicken Bonds: Create a methodology to ascertain fair value  RiskDAO focuses on protocol-specific risks, primarily to avoid bad debt. Given the increase in cross-chain activity, the risk framework has been broadened to account for risk vectors from cross-chain exposure. A description of our works is available on our website and blog.  Vision for MakerDAO RiskDAO is also going through the process of implementing DAO structures. This involves creating open source code & risk frameworks, community development and contributor onboarding. We are an agile organization that can adapt to MakerDAO’s future: RiskDAO will be a highly valuable Delegate both in the existing state or if Maker transitions to the “endgame” structure.  Operational implementation RiskDAO’s vote will be coordinated by nonstopTheo who also serves as your point of contact for any questions. We employ strict internal communication processes: All votes will be discussed internally first before published to the public forum.  Conflicts of Interest  The RiskDAO is giving risk assessment service to other lending markets and stablecoin platforms. B.Protocol has a pending MIP that will benefit B.Protocol. However, it is no longer actively pursued.   Disclosure This section discloses previous interactions between B.Protocol and Maker for full transparency, given that members of RiskDAO are contributors to B.Protocol. There are no conflicts of interests from these past actions.  One of B.Protocol’s contributors set a precedent in 2020 by using a flash loan to influence a governance vote. The issue has been discussed at length and lessons have been learnt.

content.content: Ratification Poll for Endgame Prelaunch MIP Set - October 10, 2022 Poll ID: 882 Vote YES✅ We are excited to support the transition to a more decentralized state as suggested by the Endgame proposal. We support the subproposals as they facilitate governance structures. We also support changes to the core unit mandates as part of the Endgame preparation & eventual transition. Ratification Poll for Offboarding the Strategic Happiness Core Unit - SH-001 (MIP39c3-SP3) - October 10, 2022 Poll ID: 883 Vote YES✅ We support the offboarding of the strategic happiness core unit. We are believers in and advocates of fun & engagement around MakerDAO  but do not see the immediate benefit of the core unit to the DAO’s operations. Ratification Poll for Offboarding the Events Core Unit - EVENTS-001 (MIP39c3-SP4) - October 10, 2022 Poll ID: 884 Vote YES✅ We consider events incredibly relevant for crypto developer relations and community building. Real life events remain one of the most important platforms to reach developers and increase integrations with other protocols. However, as MakerDAO is moving towards the Endgame state, we understand there is less need for a standalone unit. Events will be handled in a separate organizational form going forward. Ratification Poll for Offboarding the Real-World Finance Core Unit - RWF-001 (MIP39c3-SP5) - October 10, 2022 Poll ID: 885 Vote YES✅: The proposed action is required to prepare MakerDAO for the Endgame/MetaDAO transition. Ratification Poll for Facilitator Offboarding - RWF-001 (MIP41c5-SP12) - October 10, 2022 Poll ID: 890 Vote YES✅: There is no need for a dedicated facilitator if the RWF unit is offboarded. Ratification Poll for Coinbase USDC Institutional Rewards (MIP81) - October 10, 2022 Poll ID: 886 Vote Yes✅ We acknowledge the opportunity to generate additional revenues in economically challenging times like these and thus support this proposal. Ratification Poll for Monetalis-Coinbase Appaloosa (MIP82) - October 10, 2022 Poll ID: 887 Vote Abstain We point out the lack of legal & technical clarity. We would require more information why Coinbase would pay 4.5%-6% with ETH/BTC as collateral, when current lending rates are much lower across DeFi. Coinbase has a non-investment grade issuer rating by Standard & Poors (BB) and their outstanding notes are trading well above 6% yields. Ratification Poll for Legal And Commercial Risk Domain Work on Greenlit Collateral BlockTower Credit - RWA Arranger SPF (MIP55c3-SP9) - October 10, 2022 Poll ID: 888 Vote YES✅ We acknowledge the need for proper legal reviews. In general, we would prefer to see fee scales so that work can be stopped if a certain roadblock is hit, before spending the entire cost budget. We would also prefer to see expected revenues from an onboarded client to put the fees in context. Ratification Poll for Facilitator Offboarding Process (MIP41c5) adjustments (MIP4c2-SP26) - October 10, 2022 Poll ID: 889 Vote YES✅ We support the streamlined process and faster implementation of Facilitator offoboarding.
